alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 6:54AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Richland and Wilkin Counties. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in North Dakota... Pembina River at Walhalla affecting Cavalier and Pembina Counties. .Snowmelt river flooding to continue. Rate of rise and ultimate crest is uncertain due to potential for ice jamming, rate of ongoing snowmelt runoff and possible rain and snow as well as colder temperatures in the forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Some local flooding begins on rural roads and approaches to bridges. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM CDT Monday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 15.0 feet early Monday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
